```{r setup knit, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
	fig.align = "center",
	fig.pos = "H",
	message = FALSE,
	warning = FALSE,
	external = TRUE,
	echo = TRUE
)

library(tidyverse)
library(data.table)
library(magrittr)
library(ggsci)
library(kableExtra)
library(SPREDA)

source("../R_script/functions.R")
```


```{r clean data}
# load raw data and clean
ismort_death_count <- 
  readxl::read_excel("../data/IS_data.xlsx") %>% 
  clean_data(cols_to_numeric = c("Day after spray","Deaths"))

# convert death counts to death status
ismort_death_status <- 
  ismort_death_count %>% 
  convert_to_death_status()

# split data into 5 folds for cross validation later
folds <- caret::createFolds(1:nrow(ismort_death_status), k = 5, list = TRUE, returnTrain = FALSE)
```


```{r calculate empirical ttt, message=FALSE}
# set length out for quantile sequence
set_length_out <- 2000

# calculate empirical total time on test 
empirical_ttt <- 
  ismort_death_status %>% 
  group_by(Population, Treatment, Age, Sex) %>% 
  do(data.frame(u = seq(0, 1, length.out = set_length_out),
                ttt = get_ttt_quantile(.$Day, set_length_out),
                tag = paste(.$Population[1], .$Treatment[1])))
```


## Empirical TTT {.tabset}

### ACO 

```{r fig.width=7}
empirical_ttt %>% filter(Population == "ACO") %>% plot_ttt_quantile()
```

### CO

```{r fig.width=7, fig.height=8}
empirical_ttt %>% filter(Population == "CO") %>% plot_ttt_quantile()
```
